casebody.data:
HIGH BAILIFF. BUCK against MARSH. IN an action on a jail bond, the plaintiff declared on a jail bond taken and assigned by the High Bailiff, and did not alledge the cause of his (H. B.) acting as Sheriff. On a writ of error, declaration held good; also, there was no error in this, that the writ, directed to the High Bailiff, acting as Sheriff, did not state the cause of its being so directed.

Bennington,

1816.
